item.title: They want our silence, but we will not give it to them
item.description: From late Thursday night through the early hours of Friday, December 19, my colleagues at The Daily Star were trapped on the roof of their burning workplace, unsure if they would survive.

item.title: Persistent violence must be reined in
item.description: Brutal attacks in Mymensingh and Lakshmipur point to continuous violence.

item.title: The press under fire, and the cost of mistaking destruction for change
item.description: The image of a burnt copy of The Daily Star, dated Victory Day, is difficult to shake off. It stays with you long after you scroll past it on your social media newsfeed—not because it is dramatic, but because of what it reveals.
